When you like someone, you like them in spite of their faults. When you love someone, you love them with their faults. - Hermann Hesse
Give your weakness to one who helps. - Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
Always remember, your focus determines your reality. - George Lucas
Power-lust is a weed that grows only in the vacant lots of an abandoned mind. - Ayn Rand
Our Age of Anxiety is, in great part, the result of trying to do today's jobs with yesterday's tools! - Marshall McLuhan
To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive, and the true success is to labour. - Robert Louis Stevenson
You came and I was longing for you. You cooled a heart that burned with desire. - Sappho
Don't let what you can't do get in the way of what you can do. - JuÌˆrgen Boedt
The fiercest anger of all, the most incurable, Is that which rages in the place of dearest love. - Euripides

A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal. - Oscar Wilde
If you love something so much let it go. If it comes back it was meant to be; if it doesn't it never was - Albert Schweitzer
There is always something left to love. - Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez
Fight for the only thing she knew was good enough, noble enough, powerful enough to be worth risking everything... Love. - Lauren Kate
The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled. - Plutarch
You'll never find a rainbow if you're looking down - Charlie Chaplin
The intelligent man is one who has successfully fulfilled many accomplishments, and is yet willing to learn more. - Ed Parker
No aacomplishments are important than self realization of self satisfaction. - Santosh Kalwar
Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something. - Plato
There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living. - Nelson Mandela
There are no tomorrow's and there was no yesterday, what you have now is what you will have. - Santosh Kalwar
Relationships are like an algebraic equations:what happens on one side affect the other. - Kim Barnes
To realize one's Personal Legend is a person's only real obligation. - Paulo Coelho
Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes. - Eleanor Roosevelt
I do not scruple to employ mendacity and a fictitious appearance of female incompetence when the occasion demands it. - Elizabeth Peters
Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on when others have let go. - William Feather
Let me never fall into the vulgar mistake of dreaming that I am persecuted whenever I am contradicted. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
A light heart lives long. - William Shakespeare
Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit. - Napoleon Hill
If you kiss someone on the back of the neck, it spreads. - H. Jackson Brown Jr.
True love stories never have endings. - Richard Bach
First you jump off the cliff and build your wings on the way down. - Ray Bradbury
Step up and move ahead, life is all about moving on and traveling all along like a bird. - Santosh Kalwar
What sort of love is permeated by jealousy? You are jealous because you are unaware that everything you need is inside you. - Peter Deunov
Grace is the face that love wears when it meets imperfection. - Joseph R. Cooke
One can beg, buy, be presented with and find love in the streets, but it can never be stolen. - Hermann Hesse
The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for. - Oscar Wilde
He who refuses to embrace a unique opportunity loses the prize as surely as if he had tried and failed. - William James
When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world. - John Muir
There's only one racing strategy that https://t.co/uNUqSogfG0's the one I run by: Get in the lead and don't let anyone pass you. - Megan McCafferty
No matter how your heart is grieving, if you keep on believing, the dreams that you wish will come true. - Walt Disney Company
You can't find someone who doesn't want to be found. - Isabel Allende
It is necessary to hope... for hope itself is happiness. - Samuel Johnson
I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing. - Anaïs Nin
One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence. - Karen Marie Moning
Love is space and time measured by the heart. - Marcel Proust
The greatest accomplishment is not in never falling, but in rising again after you fall. - Vince Lombardi
Not knowing you can't do something, is sometimes all it takes to do it. - Ally Carter
The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is. - C.S. Lewis
Hope is not a feeling of certainty that everything ends well. Hope is just a feeling that life and work have a meaning. - VÃ¡clav Havel
Self-esteem comes from being able to define the world in your own terms and refusing to abide by the judgments of others. - Oprah Winfrey
What we do is nothing but a drop in the ocean, but if we didn't do it, the ocean would be one drop less - Mother Teresa
If only she could be so oblivious again, to feel such love without knowing it, mistaking it for laughter. - Markus Zusak

When you re the only one to do something it always gets done. - Robert Newton Peck
If you don't receive love from the ones who are meant to love you, you will never stop looking for it. - Robert Goolrick
To belittle is to be little. - Kalil Gibran
A light heart lives long. - William Shakespeare
I suffer because my interactions with others do not meet the expectations I did not know I had. - Jim McDonald
Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air. - John Quincy Adams
The cosmos is neither moral or immoral; only people are. He who would move the world must first move himself. - Edward Ericson
Life begins on the other side of despair. - Jean-Paul Sartre

it takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeded. - Anne Morrow Lindbergh
If we admit that human life can be ruled by reason, then all possibility of life is destroyed. - Leo Tolstoy
Worry is most often a prideful way of thinking that you have more control over life and its circumstances than you actually do. - June Hunt
Don't be afraid to take a big step if one is indicated. You can't cross a chasm in two small jumps. - David Lloyd George
It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong, than to be always right by having no ideas at all. - Edward de Bono
Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters. - Lucius Annaeus Seneca
The most effective people are those who can "hold" their vision while remaining committed to seeing current reality clearly - Peter M. Senge
Happiness is the meaning and purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence. - Aristotle
All love that has not friendship for its base, is like a mansion built upon sand. - Ella Wheeler Wilcox
With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts. - Eleanor Roosevelt
Love is not a habit, a commitment, or a debt. It isn't what romantic songs tell us it is - love simply is. - Paulo Coelho
If you like her, if she makes you happy, and if you feel like you know her--then don't let her go. - Nicholas Sparks
There is not a particle of life which does not bear poetry within it - Gustave Flaubert
Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there. - Will Rogers
The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance. - Alan Watts
I try to make my comments like a woman's skirt: long enough to be respectable and short enough to be interesting. - Adam Clayton Powell
True love always makes a man better, no matter what woman inspires it. - Alexandre Dumas
One's first love is always perfect until one meets one's second love. - Elizabeth Aston
Greatness lies not in being strong, but in the right use of strength. - Henry Ward Beecher
Love doesn't mean doing extraordinary or heroic things. It means knowing how to do ordinary things with tenderness. - Jean Vanier

Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed. - Corita Kent
Keep in mind to be kind. - A. Volta
